raw_text:
Wipro beats forecasts once again
 
 Wipro, India's third-biggest software firm, has reported a 60% rise in profit, topping market expectations.
 
 Net income in the last quarter was 4.3bn rupees ($98m; £52m), against 2.7bn a year earlier. Profit had been forecast to be 4.1bn rupees. Wipro offers services such as call centres to foreign clients and has worked for more than half of the companies on the Fortune 500 list. Wipro said demand was strong, allowing it to increase the prices it charged.
 
 "On the face of it, the results don't look very exciting," said Apurva Shah, an analyst at ASK-Raymond James. "But the guidance is positive and pricing going up is good news." Third-quarter sales rose 34% to 20.9bn rupees. One problem identified by Wipro was the high turnover of its staff. It said that 90% of employees at its business process outsourcing operations had had to be replaced. "We have to get that under control," said vice-chairman Vivek Paul. Wipro is majority owned by India's richest man Azim Premji.
llama3.2:1b: Wipro reports a 60% rise in profit, beating market expectations, with net income of 4.3bn rupees ($98m) and forecasted to be 4.1bn rupees. Demand for Wipro services is strong, leading to price increases. The company's sales rose 34% to 20.9bn rupees in the third quarter.
llama3.2:3b: Wipro, India's third-largest software firm, has reported a 60% rise in profit with net income reaching 4.3 billion rupees, beating market expectations. Demand was strong and pricing increased, but high staff turnover of 90% remains an issue.
gemma2:2b: Wipro exceeded profit expectations with a 60% increase in net income, driven by strong demand and price increases for its services.  The company reported sales growth of 34%, but high staff turnover within its business process outsourcing operations is an area for improvement.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Wipro, a third-largest Indian software firm, reported a 60% rise in profit for the quarter ending September 30, beating market expectations. Wipro offers call center services and has worked on over half of the Fortune 500 companies. The company's sales increased 34% to 20.9 billion rupees (about $381 million). Employees at its business process outsourcing operations had a turnover rate of 90%, which was identified by the vice-chairman Vivek Paul as a problem that needs to be addressed.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Wipro reports a 60% profit increase, beating forecasts and topping market expectations with net income of $98m; Q3 sales rise 34%, but high staff turnover remains an issue. CEO Vivek Paul pledges to control employee turnover at business process outsourcing operations. Wipro is majority-owned by India's richest man Azim Premji.
qwen2.5:3b: Wipro beats profit forecasts with a 60% increase, reaching 4.3bn rupees in net income from 2.7bn a year ago. The company reported strong demand allowing it to raise prices. Sales grew 34% to 20.9bn rupees. Despite positive guidance and pricing increases, turnover issues at its business process outsourcing operations remain an issue. Majority-owned by India's richest man Azim Premji, Wipro serves over half of the Fortune 500 companies through call centres and other services.
opencoder:1.5b: Wipro has reported a 60% rise in profit, forecasts once again. Net income in the last quarter was 4.3bn rupees ($98m; £52m), against 2.7bn a year earlier. Profit had been forecast to be 4.1bn rupees. Wipro offers services such as call centres to foreign clients and has worked for more than half of the companies on the Fortune 500 list. Wipro increased market expectations, allowing it to increase the prices it charged. The guidance is positive and pricing going up is good news. Sales rose 34% to 20.9bn rupees. An issue was identified by Wipro about its staff turnover, which requires efficient management.
smollm:1.7b:
Wipro beats forecasts once again, with a 60% rise in profit and a net income of $98 million (£52 million). Profit had been forecast to be $4.1 billion last quarter, up from $4.7 billion. Wipro's services business is the largest contributor to its revenue, accounting for around 30% of its total earnings. The company has reported strong growth in recent quarters, driven by increasing demand from foreign clients and higher prices it charges.

The results don't look very exciting on their own, but the positive guidance from Wipro's management team is welcome news. Profit was up 34% to $98 million last quarter, exceeding expectations. The company has reported strong growth in its services business, which accounts for around 60% of its total earnings. However, there are concerns about the high turnover of its staff, with one problem identified by Wipro being the high rate of employee attrition.

The management team at Wipro is confident that it can continue to drive growth in the coming quarters. "We have to get that under control," said Vivek Paul, a senior executive at Wipro. "We need to attract and retain more customers, improve our operations and increase our pricing." The company has reported strong revenue growth in recent quarters, driven by increasing demand from foreign clients and higher prices it charges.

Overall, the results are positive, but there are still some challenges ahead for Wipro. The management team is confident that they can continue to drive growth in the coming quarters, but there are concerns about the high turnover of its staff and the need to improve its operations.

First, I need to read through the given text carefully. It's about Wipro beating forecasts with a 60% profit increase, mentioning net income growth, services offered, company size, pricing strategy, and some analysis from an analyst. The user wants a concise summary that includes all these points while preserving key details.

I'll start by identifying the main elements: Wipro's significant performance, their profit increase percentage, revenue numbers, types of services, market share, pricing approach, and challenges like high employee turnover and management structure.

Next, I need to condense each point without losing important information. The summary should flow logically, ensuring all key ideas are included. I'll make sure not to include any extra details beyond what's essential for understanding the main points of Wipro's performance and success.

I also notice that the user specified no explanations or formatting, so the summary must be clean and straightforward. It shouldn't have any markdown or additional text around it.

Finally, I'll structure the summary by first stating Wipro's big win, then providing specific financial data like net income, profit increase, revenue growth, services offered, company size, pricing strategy, challenges faced, and ownership details of the parent company.

By following these steps, I can create a clear and concise summary that meets the user's requirements.
</think>

Wipro has beaten forecasts with a 60% profit surge, earning 4.3 billion rupees for its last quarter, topping expectations. It services foreign clients, operates on the Fortune 500 list, and raised prices after facing high employee turnover from outsourcing. Wipro owns the majority of Azim Premji's company.
tinyllama:1.1b: Wipro, one of India's largest software firms, has reported a 60% rise in profit for the first quarter, beating market expectations. The net income was 4.3 billion rupees ($98 million; £52 million), against 2.7 billion rupees in the same period last year. Wipro offered services to more than half of the Fortune 500 companies. The company said it's optimistic about the demand for its products and services, which allowed it to increase prices. Sales rose by 34% to 20.9 billion rupees in the first quarter, and one problem identified was the high turnover of staff at BPO operations. Wipro attributed the rise in profitability to cost cuts and investments in technologies. The company is majority-owned by Azim Premji, who's India's richest man.

However, the company identified high employee turnover as a challenge and vowed to improve this figure, with 25% of employees in outsourcing operations having had to be replaced.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Wipro, India's leading software firm, surpassed expectations with a 60% increase in quarterly profit, reaching 4.3 billion rupees ($98m; £52m), compared to 2.7 billion rupees a year prior. Despite the modest growth figure, analysts like Apurva Shah from ASK-Raymond James view the results positively due to strong demand and increased pricing. Third-quarter sales grew by 34% to 20.9 billion rupees. However, Wipro faced a significant challenge: a high staff turnover rate of 90% in its business process outsourcing division. Vice-chairman Vivek Paul acknowledged this as an issue that needs improvement. Wipro is majority owned by India's wealthiest man, Azim Premji.
reference: Wipro said demand was strong, allowing it to increase the prices it charged.Profit had been forecast to be 4.1bn rupees.Wipro, India's third-biggest software firm, has reported a 60% rise in profit, topping market expectations.Net income in the last quarter was 4.3bn rupees ($98m; £52m), against 2.7bn a year earlier.One problem identified by Wipro was the high turnover of its staff.
